name: chatgpt_gdb_600x600_3800_undersized
description: [ChatGPT] GDB 600x600 at 3800 mÂ³/h â†’ undersized (limit 3400), suggest 600x900
query: I need a GDB housing 600x600 for 3800 mÂ³/h airflow. FZ material.

turns.content: I need a GDB housing 600x600 for 3800 mÂ³/h airflow. FZ material.

To handle the required airflow of 3800 mÂ³/h with a GDB housing, we need to use two GDB-600x600 units in parallel, as a single unit cannot handle the load. The effective housing dimensions will be 1200x600mm.Which housing length do you need?Additionally, the requested 3800 airflow_m3h exceeds the recommended flow of 3400 for a single 600x600 module. 2 parallel units are required. Alternatively, a single 600x900 mm module can handle 5100 mÂ³/h.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identifies that the requested airflow (3800 mÂ³/h) exceeds the maximum capacity of the requested GDB 600x600 housing (3400 mÂ³/h). It provides two technically valid solutions (a larger single unit or a double-width unit) derived directly from the catalog data and correctly pauses to ask for the missing housing length parameter before finalizing.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Verified against PDF p.9: GDB 600x600 has a max flow of 3400 mÂ³/h, and GDB 600x900 has 5100 mÂ³/h; the system's data is exact.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response addresses the sizing conflict, offers specific alternatives, and asks for the necessary missing parameter (length).
dimension_explanations.safety: Correctly prevents undersizing the unit, which would lead to excessive pressure drop and velocity.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Clear engineering logic: Airflow > Capacity â†’ Suggest next size up or parallel arrangement.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to the airflow capacity limits defined in the product catalog.

strengths: Accurate retrieval of airflow capacity limits from catalog tables
Proactive suggestion of alternative sizes (600x900 or 1200x600) to meet the requirement
Correctly identifies missing parameter (length) without hallucinating a default

However, it made a dimensional/arrangement error by stating the combined parallel face would be 1200x600 mm, which conflicts with the catalogâ€™s widthÃ—height convention and typical parallel-bank geometry.

anthropic.explanation: The system correctly identifies that a single GDB 600x600 (3400 mÂ³/h per PDF p.9) cannot handle 3800 mÂ³/h and proposes valid alternatives: two parallel 600x600 units (effective 1200x600) or a single 600x900 (5100 mÂ³/h). The clarification request for housing length is appropriate since GDB comes in 550/600 and 750/800 mm lengths. Minor imprecision in stating '2 parallel units' when the catalog actually shows 1200x600 as a single housing size with 2 full modules, but the engineering logic is sound.

dimension_explanations.correctness: GDB 600x600 flow is 3400 mÂ³/h (PDF p.9), correctly identified as insufficient for 3800 mÂ³/h; GDB 600x900 = 5100 mÂ³/h (PDF p.9) is a valid alternative; the suggestion of 1200x600 (6800 mÂ³/h) as two parallel 600x600 modules is slightly misleading since 1200x600 is its own catalog size, but the underlying sizing logic is correct.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The system addresses airflow mismatch, proposes two alternatives (parallel arrangement and larger single module), and asks for the missing housing length parameter; it could have mentioned weight or connection type options.
dimension_explanations.safety: The system correctly flags that the requested airflow exceeds the single module capacity and does not allow an oversized configuration to proceed without correction, though it could have mentioned pressure drop implications of oversizing.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative, though the response mixes natural language with what appears to be system-internal variable names (airflow_m3h), which slightly detracts from polish.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Clear cause-effect chain: 3800 > 3400 â†’ single module insufficient â†’ two options presented with specific airflow values; the logic is transparent and well-structured.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Correctly respects the airflow capacity constraint of the 600x600 module, does not allow an over-capacity configuration, and properly asks for the missing length parameter before finalizing.

strengths: Correctly identifies that 3800 mÂ³/h exceeds the 3400 mÂ³/h capacity of a single GDB 600x600 and blocks the configuration
Provides two viable alternatives (1200x600 parallel arrangement and 600x900 single module) with correct airflow values
Appropriately requests housing length before providing a final product card
weaknesses: The phrasing 'two GDB-600x600 units in parallel' is slightly misleading â€” the catalog lists 1200x600 as a single housing with 2 full filter modules, not literally two separate housings
Includes system-internal notation (airflow_m3h) in the user-facing response, reducing professionalism
